intro: Chlidanthus luteus, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. The leaves are palmately lobed, and the plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
